feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 11:46AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN FOR LATE WEEK INTO THE WEEKEND... An atmospheric river has started moving across the northern half of Southeast Alaska. Heavy rain started late Wednesday night near Yakutat, and is expected to slide over the northern inner channels on Friday. So far the Yakutat airport has received 1.81 inches of rain. The heavier rain is expected to last through Saturday morning

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued September 01 at 9:14AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...OZONE HIGH POLLUTION ADVISORY FOR MARICOPA COUNTY INCLUDING THE PHOENIX METRO AREA FRIDAY... The Arizona Department of Environmental Quality (ADEQ) has issued an Ozone High Pollution Advisory for the Phoenix Metro Area on Friday. This means that forecast weather conditions combined with existing ozone levels are expected to result in local maximum 8-hour ozone

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 10:12AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY... Moderate to severe drought across the region has resulted in elevated fire weather concerns for today. Relative humidity values will drop to near 35 percent this afternoon with northwest gusts between 15 and 25 mph. Any fire that ignites will have the potential to rapidly spread in these conditions.

entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY FOR MASSACHUSETTS, CONNECTICUT, AND RHODE ISLAND... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 9:37AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY... Moderate to severe drought conditions have led to very dry soil moistures and ground fuels. entry.summary: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITIES POSSIBLE ACROSS PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST OREGON AND SOUTHWEST IDAHO FRIDAY AND SATURDAY... .An upper trough will move through the Pacific Northwest late Friday into Saturday. entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued September 01 at 3:33PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR SOUTHWESTERN LABETTE COUNTY IS CANCELLED... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning has been cancelled. However gusty winds are still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 2:52PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Labette and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 252 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coffeyville, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cameron Parish through 345 PM CDT... At 319 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cameron. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 10:12AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY... Moderate to severe drought across the region has resulted in elevated fire weather concerns for today. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 3:12PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Smith, southeastern Wood and southwestern Upshur Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 312 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lindale to 9 miles south of Big Sandy. Movement was north at 10 mph.
